books.title: A Game of Thrones
books.author: George R. R. Martin
books.quote: Everything's better with some wine in the belly.

books.title: A Good Year
books.author: Peter Mayle
books.quote: The wine, a rich, dark burgundy, was poured into glasses, and they all raised their glasses in a toast.

books.title: The Secret of Santa Vittoria
books.author: Robert Crichton
books.quote: They were about to lose a million bottles of wine to the Germans.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.quote: In the main hall a bar with a real brass rail was set up, and stocked with gins and liquors and with cordials so long forgotten that most of his female guests were too young to know one from another.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.quote: Harry watched Hagrid getting redder and redder in the face as he called for more wine, finally kissing Professor McGonagall on the cheek, who, to Harry's amazement, giggled and blushed, her top hat lop-sided.

books.title: The Winemaker's Wife
books.author: Kristin Harmel
books.quote: She sipped her wine and thought back to the harvest of 1940, the last year she had been here.

books.title: Sideways
books.author: Rex Pickett
books.quote: We had both ordered the lamb, and I went with a Rhône wine, a Châteauneuf-du-Pape.

books.title: The Sun Also Rises
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.quote: We lunched upstairs at Botin’s. It is one of the best restaurants in the world. We had roast young suckling pig and drank rioja alta.

books.title: The Duke & I
books.author: Julia Quinn
books.quote: Violet Bridgerton loved tea. She loved the ritual of it, the serenity it brought, the way a good hot cup could warm her from the inside out.

books.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
books.author: Stieg Larsson
books.quote: Coffee was the only reason she could survive all-nighters. The stronger, the better.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.quote: So Thorin went on: 'We don't want any more washing, all that we had was quite enough; and we also don't want any more baking or boiling. We shall sit here and drink beer.
